text: Is there a way to force a cache refresh on a HubDB table? It seems like that caches independently and it’s making it difficult to make quick changes in dev.
i swear <@U6GNQ7JBU> told me how to do this once...a long time ago
<@U7SL518D6> Correct me if i’m wrong but the HS Dev tools chrome plugin’s cache buster should do the trick, its been a while since i have used it but i think i remember that working for me.
The extension’s cachebuster trick likely would work. if it’s not, let me know, I’ll look into it
Cache buster isn’t doing the trick, it appears that the table itself is being cached. Also :wave:  hi fellas it’s been a while!
<@U26DA9CQ0> Can u elaborate the issue? I tried my test portal and I see table changes reflecting in few seconds in pages..

That’s strange. I’m making changes on a table that is being called from the navigation on sandbox pages. Specifically I am updating images from table rows. It is working but taking ~ 30-60 minutes to see changes, even when I try all the normal cache refresh tricks (incognito browser, hard refresh, query string)
i've had the same issues... i haven't had it take 30 minutes, but I've noticed it taking several minutes sometimes...
I am pushing a fix for this in few mins
Pushed the fix and its working now. Let me know if you see anything wrong..

I’m getting this error on a hubdb page, and the page is returning zero results from the table.
We noticed this last week, but then it started working. Now, it is not and chrome is returning the error below

```A cookie associated with a cross-site resource at <http://HubSpot.net/> was set without the `SameSite` attribute. A future release of Chrome will only deliver cookies with cross-site requests if they are set with `SameSite=None` and `Secure`. You can review cookies in developer tools under Application>Storage>Cookies and see more details at <https://www.chromestatus.com/feature/5088147346030592> and <https://www.chromestatus.com/feature/5633521622188032>.```
can u DM me your template and content page links?
Also, is there any reason why HubDB/HubSpot is adding `?hsLang=es-us` to some dynamic links?
for those interested, the portal had enabled language specific redirects, so that is why
